(2) A OCTROOIAANVRAAG

HO1L 21/306 (2024.01) C23F 1/16 (2024.01) Aanvraag ingediend: 30 juli 2024 Voorrang: 28 mei 2024 CN 2024106673865 @® Aanvrager(s): Hangzhou Vocational and Technical College te Hangzhou, China, CN Aanvraag ingeschreven: 29 augustus 2024 ® Uitvinder(s): Aanvraag gepubliceerd: 29 augustus 2024 Xiaomin Ding te Hangzhou (CN) Yichen Ding te Hangzhou (CN)

ETCHANT FOR SEMICONDUCTOR MATERIAL PROCESSING AND ITS PREPARATION METHOD

The invention discloses an etchant for semiconductor material processing, comprising the following raw materials: inorganic acid solution, surfactant, and additive. The inorganic acid solution includes hydrofluoric acid, nitric acid, acetic acid, hydrochloric acid, hydrogen peroxide, sulfuric acid, and water. The surfactant includes fatty acid salt, alkylphenol ether, sodium dodecyl sulfate, sodium dodecylbenzene sulfonate, and polyethylene glycol. The preparation method of the etchant for semiconductor material processing includes the following steps: step 1, selecting raw materials; step 2, preparing the inorganic acid solution; step 3, preparing the surfactant; step 4, preparingthe additive; step 5, mixing to obtain the finished product. The invention comprises inorganic acid solution and surfactant, providing good environmental performance, achieving fine etching of semiconductor materials at a lower cost.

Technical Field

The invention relates to the technical field of semiconductor material processing, specifically to an etchant for semiconductor material processing and its preparation method.

Background Technology

Semiconductor materials are a class of electronic materials with semiconductor properties, used to manufacture semiconductor devices and integrated circuits. Etching is an important process in semiconductor material processing. It involves removing material through chemical reactions or physical impact to selectively corrode the surface of semiconductor materials, forming the required patterns or structures for precisely removing unnecessary parts. However, traditional etchants exhibit slow etching rates and unsatisfactory effects. Additionally, the preparation process of traditional etchants is complex and costly, failing to meet the modern demands for high precision, high efficiency, and low pollution in semiconductor processing. Therefore, there is a need for an etchant for semiconductor material processing and its preparation method.

Summary of the Invention

The objective of this invention is to provide an etchant for semiconductor material processing and its preparation method to solve the problems presented in the background technology. To achieve the above objective, the invention provides the following technical solution: an etchant for semiconductor material processing, comprising the following raw materials: inorganic acid solution, surfactant, and additive. The inorganic acid solution includes hydrofluoric acid, nitric acid, acetic acid, hydrochloric acid, hydrogen peroxide, sulfuric acid, and water. The surfactant includes fatty acid salt, alkylphenol ether, sodium dodecyl sulfate, sodium dodecylbenzene sulfonate, polyethylene glycol, fatty alcohol polyoxyethylene ether sulfate, alkanolamide, and fatty acid methyl ester ethoxylates. The additive includes corrosion inhibitor, anti-fog agent, water, ethanol, and acetone. A preparation method for an etchant for semiconductor material processing includes the following steps: step 1, selecting raw materials; step 2, preparing the inorganic acid solution; step 3, preparing the surfactant; step 4, preparing the additive; step 5, mixing to obtain the finished product. step 5, mixing to obtain the finished product. In step 1, personnel select inorganic acid solution, surfactant, and additive according to quality requirements. The inorganic acid solution includes hydrofluoric acid, nitric acid, acetic acid, hydrochloric acid, hydrogen peroxide, sulfuric acid, and water, and weigh the following components by weight: hydrofluoric acid 10-20 parts, nitric acid 15-25 parts, acetic acid 5-10 parts, hydrochloric acid 10-20 parts, hydrogen peroxide 15-25 parts, sulfuric acid 5-10 parts, water 40-60 parts, fatty acid salt 10-20 parts, alkylphenol ether 5-10 parts, sodium dodecyl sulfate 5-10 parts, sodium dodecylbenzene sulfonate 15-25 parts, polyethylene glycol 5-10 parts, fatty alcohol polyoxyethylene ether sulfate 15-25 parts, alkanolamide 5-10 parts, fatty acid methyl ester ethoxylates 5-10 parts, corrosion inhibitor 15-25 parts, anti-fog agent 10-20 parts, ethanol 5-10 parts, acetone 5-10 parts. ethanol 5-10 parts, acetone 5-10 parts. In step 2, hydrofluoric acid, nitric acid, acetic acid, hydrochloric acid, hydrogen peroxide, sulfuric acid, and water are proportionally introduced into a reaction kettle and stirred to prepare the inorganic acid solution for later use. In step 3, personnel stir and mix fatty acid salt, alkylphenol ether, sodium dodecyl sulfate, sodium dodecylbenzene sulfonate, polyethylene glycol, fatty alcohol polyoxyethylene ether sulfate, alkanolamide, and fatty acid methyl ester ethoxylates proportionally to prepare the surfactant. The addition of fatty alcohol polyoxyethylene ether sulfate provides good wetting, foaming, and washing performance. The addition of alkanolamide imparts antistatic effects and enhances washing power and solubility, while the addition of fatty acid methy! ester ethoxylates imparts good detergency and fluidity. In step 4, corrosion inhibitor, anti-fog agent, and water are stirred and mixed proportionally to prepare the additive. In step 5, the prepared inorganic acid solution and surfactant are introduced into the reaction kettle for mixing and uniformly stirred at a speed of 200-500 rpm for 10- 30 minutes. The mixture is heated to 60°C-80°C during stirring. After the mixture cools to room temperature, the additive is added and stirred uniformly at a speed of 500 rpm for 10 minutes to obtain the finished etchant. Preferably, the inorganic acid solution provides an acidic environment to promote the etching reaction. By adjusting the concentration of the inorganic acid, the etching speed and effect can be controlled. Preferably, the surfactant reduces the surface tension of the etching solution, enhancing its wettability and improving the etching effect, particularly improving etching efficiency for microstructures. 10 etching efficiency for microstructures. Preferably, the additive improves the performance of the etching solution, reducing the corrosion effect on the etched material and increasing processing accuracy. The addition of the anti-fog agent reduces fogging during processing, increasing product yield. The corrosion inhibitor includes organic acids, organic amines, and thiourea, while the anti-fog agent consists of silicone compounds that effectively reduce the surface tension of the solution, preventing water vapor condensation and thereby reducing fog generation. 20 The beneficial effects of the present invention compared to the existing technology are: technology are: The invention, comprising inorganic acid solution, surfactant, and additive, offers superior environmental performance compared to existing technology. It achieves fine etching of semiconductor materials in a short time, meeting various process requirements. The addition of surfactant significantly enhances the wettability, washability, antistatic effect, solubility, detergency, and fluidity of the etching solution, thereby improving the etching effect. This is particularly beneficial for the etching efficiency of microstructures. The addition of additives further improves the performance of the etching solution by reducing the corrosion effect on the etched materials, enhancing processing precision. Additionally, the etching process does not produce harmful gases, making it environmentally friendly. By incorporating corrosion inhibitors and anti-fog agents, the solution’s surface tension is effectively reduced, preventing water vapor condensation and thus reducing fog formation, thereby increasing product yield. The preparation method is simple, cost-effective, and suitable for large-scale production. The required etchant can be obtained through a simple mixing and heating process, reducing production costs and energy consumption. The waste liquid generated after use is easy to treat and recycle, benefiting environmental protection and resource recycling. The invention has broad applicability, not only suitable for the etching process of semiconductor materials such as silicon wafers, germanium wafers, and gallium arsenide but also applicable to other semiconductor

Description of Drawings

20 FIG.1: Schematic diagram of the preparation process of the invention. FIG.2: Schematic diagram of the composition of the etchant of the invention. FIG.3: Schematic diagram of the composition of the inorganic acid solution of the invention. FIG.4: Schematic diagram of the composition of the additive of the invention.

Specific Embodiments

The following detailed description of the embodiments of the invention will be provided in conjunction with the accompanying drawings, which clearly and completely describe the technical solutions of the embodiments. It is evident that the described embodiments are only part of the embodiments of the invention, not all of them. Based on the embodiments of the invention, all other embodiments obtained by those of ordinary skill in the art without creative efforts fall within the protection scope of the invention. Please refer to FIGs. 1, 2, 3, and 4, which provide an embodiment of the invention: Embodiment 1 An etchant for semiconductor material processing comprises the following raw materials: inorganic acid solution, surfactant, and additive. The inorganic acid solution includes hydrofluoric acid, nitric acid, acetic acid, hydrochloric acid, hydrogen peroxide, sulfuric acid, and water. The surfactant includes fatty acid salt, alkylphenol ether, sodium dodecyl sulfate, sodium dodecylbenzene sulfonate, polyethylene glycol, fatty alcohol polyoxyethylene ether sulfate, alkanolamide, and fatty acid methy! ester ethoxylates. The additive includes corrosion inhibitor, anti-fog agent, water, ethanol, and acetone. A preparation method for the etchant for semiconductor material processing includes the following steps: step 1, selecting raw materials; step 2, preparing the inorganic acid solution; step 3, preparing the surfactant; step 4, preparing the additive; step 5, mixing to obtain the finished product. in step 1, personnel select inorganic acid solution, surfactant, and additive according to quality requirements. The inorganic acid solution includes hydrofluoric acid, nitric acid, acetic acid, hydrochloric acid, hydrogen peroxide, sulfuric acid, and water, which are weighed as follows: hydrofluoric acid 10-20 parts, nitric acid 15-25 parts, acetic acid 5-10 parts, hydrochloric acid 10-20 parts, hydrogen peroxide 15-25 parts, sulfuric acid 5-10 parts, water 40-60 parts, fatty acid salt 10-20 parts, alkylphenol ether 5-10 parts, sodium dodecyl sulfate 5-10 parts, sodium dodecylbenzene sulfonate 15-25 parts, polyethylene glycol 5-10 parts, fatty alcohol polyoxyethylene ether sulfate 15-25 parts, alkanolamide 5-10 parts, fatty acid methyl ester ethoxylates 5-10 parts, corrosion inhibitor 15-25 parts, anti-fog agent 10-20 parts, ethanol 5-10 parts, acetone 5-10 parts. In step 2, hydrofluoric acid, nitric acid, acetic acid, hydrochloric acid, hydrogen peroxide, sulfuric acid, and water are proportionally introduced into a reaction kettle and stirred to prepare the inorganic acid solution for later use. In step 3, personnel stir and mix fatty acid salt, alkylphenol ether, sodium dodecyl sulfate, sodium dodecylbenzene sulfonate, polyethylene glycol, fatty alcohol polyoxyethylene ether sulfate, alkanolamide, and fatty acid methyl ester ethoxylates proportionally to prepare the surfactant. The addition of fatty alcohol polyoxyethylene ether sulfate provides good wetting, foaming, and washing performance. The addition of alkanolamide imparts antistatic effects and enhances washing power and solubility, while the addition of fatty acid methyl ester ethoxylates imparts good detergency and fluidity. In step 4, corrosion inhibitor, anti-fog agent, and water are stirred and mixed proportionally to prepare the additive. In step 5, the prepared inorganic acid solution and surfactant are introduced into the reaction kettle for mixing and uniformly stirred at a speed of 200-500 rpm for 10- 30 minutes. The mixture is heated to 60°C -80°C during stirring. After the mixture cools to room temperature, the additive is added and stirred uniformly at a speed of 500 rpm for 10 minutes to obtain the finished etchant. 500 rpm for 10 minutes to obtain the finished etchant. Embodiment 2 The inorganic acid solution can provide an acidic environment to promote the etching reaction. By adjusting the concentration of the inorganic acid, the etching speed and effect can be controlled. The surfactant is used to reduce the surface tension of the etching solution, enhancing its wettability and improving the etching effect, particularly improving etching efficiency for microstructures. The additive can improve the performance of the etching solution, reducing the corrosion effect on the etched materials and increasing processing precision. The addition of the anti-fog agent reduces fogging during processing, increasing product yield. The corrosion inhibitor includes organic acids, organic amines, and thiourea, while the anti-fog agent consists of silicone compounds that effectively reduce the surface tension of the solution, preventing water vapor condensation and thereby reducing fog formation. The parts of the invention not detailed herein are known technologies to those skilled in the art. skilled in the art. Finally, it should be noted that the above specific embodiments are merely illustrative of the technical solutions of the invention and not restrictive. Although the invention has been described in detail with reference to the embodiments, those of ordinary skill in the art should understand that they can make modifications or equivalent replacements to the technical solutions without departing from the spirit and scope of the invention, which should be covered by the claims of the invention.

CONCLUSIES

1. Een etsmiddel voor de verwerking van halfgeleidermateriaal, gekenmerkt door het omvatten van de volgende grondstoffen: een anorganische zuuroplossing, een opperviakteactieve stof en een additief, de anorganische zuuroplossing omvattendewaterstoffluoride, salpeterzuur, azijnzuur, zoutzuur, waterstofperoxide, zwavelzuur en water, de opperviakteactieve stof omvattende vetzuurzout, alkylfenolether, natriumdodecylsulfaat, natriumdodecylbenzeensulfonaat, polyethyleenglycol, vetalcoholpolyoethyleenethersulfaat, alkanolamide en vetzuurmethyletherethoxylaten, het additief omvattende corrosieremmer, anti- condensmiddel, water, ethanol en aceton. 2. Een bereidingsmethode voor een etsmiddel voor de verwerking van halfgeleidermateriaal, omvattende de volgende stappen: stap 1, het selecteren van grondstoffen; stap 2, het bereiden van de anorganische zuuroplossing; stap 3, het bereiden van de opperviakteactieve stof; stap 4, het bereiden van het additief; stap 5, mengen om het eindproduct te verkrijgen, gekenmerkt doordat: In stap 1, selecteren de medewerkers een anorganische zuuroplossing, opperviakteactieve stof en additief volgens de kwaliteitsvereisten en wegen zij de volgende componenten af per gewicht: waterstoffluoride 10-20 delen, salpeterzuur 15-25 delen, azijnzuur 5-10 delen, zoutzuur 10-20 delen, waterstofperoxide 15-25 delen, zwavelzuur 5-10 delen, water 40-60 delen, vetzuurzout 10-20 delen, alkylfenolether 5-10 delen, natriumdodecylsulfaat 5-10 delen, natriumdodecylbenzeensulfonaat 15-25 delen, polyethyleenglycol 5-10 delen, vetalcoholpolyoethyleenethersulfaat 15-25 delen, alkanolamide 5-10 delen, vetzuurmethyletherethoxylaten 5-10 delen, corrosieremmer 15-25 delen, anti- condensmiddel 10-20 delen, ethanol 5-10 delen, aceton 5-10 delen; in stap 2 worden waterstoffluoride, salpeterzuur, azijnzuur, zoutzuur, waterstofperoxide, zwavelzuur en water proportioneel in een reactorketel ingebracht en geroerd om de anorganische zuuroplossing te bereiden voor later gebruik; in stap 3 roeren en mengen de medewerkers vetzuurzout, alkylfenolether, natriumdodecylsulfaat, natriumdodecylbenzeensulfonaat, polyethyleenglycol, vetalcoholpolyoethyleenethersulfaat, alkanolamide en vetzuurmethyletherethoxylaten proportioneel om de opperviakteactieve stof te bereiden. De toevoeging van vetalcoholpolyoethyleenethersulfaat zorgt voor goede bevochtigings-, schuim- en wasprestaties, de toevoeging van alkanolamide verleent antistatische effecten en verbetert de waskracht en oplosbaarheid, en de toevoeging van vetzuurmethyletherethoxylaten zorgt voor goede reinigingskracht en vioeibaarheid; 15 vioeibaarheid; In stap 4 worden corrosieremmer, anti-condensmiddel en water proportioneel geroerd en gemengd om het additief te bereiden; In stap 5 worden de bereide anorganische zuuroplossing en opperviakteactieve stof in de reactorketel gebracht voor menging en uniform geroerd met een snelheid van 200-500 tom gedurende 10-30 minuten; het mengsel wordt tijdens het roeren verwarmd tot 60°C -80°C; nadat het mengsel is afgekoeld tot kamertemperatuur, wordt het additief toegevoegd en uniform geroerd met een snelheid van 500 tpm gedurende 10 minuten om het eind-etsmiddel te verkrijgen. 3. De bereidingsmethode voor een etsmiddel voor de verwerking van halfgeleidermateriaal volgens conclusie 2, gekenmerkt doordat de anorganische zuuroplossing een zure omgeving biedt om de etsreactie te bevorderen; door de concentratie van het anorganische zuur aan te passen, kunnen de etssnelheid en het etseffect worden gecontroleerd. etseffect worden gecontroleerd. 4. De bereidingsmethode voor een etsmiddel voor de verwerking van halfgeleidermateriaal volgens conclusie 2, gekenmerkt doordat de opperviakteactieve stof de opperviaktespanning van de etsoplossing vermindert, waardoor de bevochtigbaarheid wordt verbeterd en het etseffect wordt verbeterd, met name de etsefficiéntie voor microstructuren. 5. De bereidingsmethode voor een etsmiddel voor de verwerking van halfgeleidermateriaal volgens conclusie 2, gekenmerkt doordat het additief de prestaties van de etsoplossing verbetert, de corrosie van het geétste materiaal vermindert en de verwerkingsnauwkeurigheid verhoogt, de toevoeging van het anti- condensmiddel condensvorming tijdens de verwerking vermindert, waardoor de productopbrengst toeneemt, de corrosieremmer omvat organische zuren, organische aminen en thioureum, terwijl het anti-condensmiddel bestaat uit siliconenverbindingen die effectief de opperviaktespanning van de oplossing verminderen, waardoor waterdampcondensatie wordt voorkomen en de condensvorming wordt verminderd.
